result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sabatia Roesha McGee

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Sabatia Roesha McGee appeared by video.  Attorney James Edgar Toran appeared by video for Sabatia Roesha McGee.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference.  
Defense counsel has not received a global offer and is requesting adjourned status date to determine case posture.
Case adjourned to Branch 30. 
This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Status conference scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Sabatia Roesha McGee appeared by video.  Attorney James Edgar Toran appeared by video for Sabatia Roesha McGee.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for the State of Wisconsin. Status conference held. Court addresses justice point discharge. Defendant confirms phone number and address. Court reinstated LEVEL 5 JUSTICE POINT SUPERVISION. Case is adjourned in Branch 30.
Status conference scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services DISCHARGE Report received and filed.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Sabatia Roesha McGee in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Sarah Dahdouh appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sabatia Roesha McGee appeared by video means with Attorney.  
Case in court for status conference.  Defense is requesting adjourned status date to determine case posture.  Case adjourned to Branch 30.  Status conference scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Attorney James Edgar Toran in court.  Sarah Dahdouh appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a pre-trial conference. Defense counsel recently appointed and needs case materials and to discuss case with client. 
Case adjourned.  Status conference scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
  Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant Sabatia Roesha McGee in court.  Jennifer Jean Tate appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 30 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Sabatia Roesha McGee not in court.  Joshua Milder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. The forfeiture order is stayed for 30 days pending notice to the defendant. Court makes a finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, restitution is not an issue.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 6-28-2022 @2:30p
